Interface StreamingRadio

  • public interface StreamingRadio
    This abstract data type represents the backend for a streaming radio service. It stores the songs, stations, and users in the system, as well as the ratings that users assign to songs.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addSong​(Song newSong)
      Adds a new song to the system.
      boolean addToStation​(Station theStation, Song theSong)
      Adds an existing song to the playlist for an existing radio station.
      void clearRating​(User theUser, Song theSong)
      Clears a user's rating on a song.
      int predictRating​(User theUser, Song theSong)
      Predicts the rating a user will assign to a song that they have not yet rated, as a number of stars from 1 to 5.

      Sets a user's rating for a song, as a number of stars from 1 to 5.

      Removes a song from the playlist for a radio station.

      Removes an existing song from the system.
      Song suggestSong​(User theUser)
      Suggests a song for a user that they are predicted to like.

    • Method Detail

      • addSong

        void addSong​(Song newSong)
      throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
             java.lang.NullPointerException
        Adds a new song to the system. If the system has not reached its maximum number of songs, then this method will add a new song to the system. If the system has already reached its maximum number of songs, then this method will double the capacity of the system and then add the new song. If the new song to be added already exists in the system, then the method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        newSong - song being added to the system
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the new song already exists in the system
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the new song being added is null

      • removeSong

        void removeSong​(Song theSong)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                java.lang.NullPointerException
        Removes an existing song from the system. If a specified song currently exists in the system, then this method removes the specified song from the system. If the specified song does not currently exist in the system, then this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        theSong - song to remove from the system
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the song to remove does not exist in the system
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the song to remove is null

      • addToStation

        boolean addToStation​(Station theStation,
                     Song theSong)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.lang.NullPointerException
        Adds an existing song to the playlist for an existing radio station. This method will add a song to a station's playlist and return true if the station allowed it. If the station did not allow the song to be added (most likely if there is a capacity limit), then the song is not added to the station's playlist and this method returns false. If the song or the station does not exist in the system, then this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        theStation - station containing the playlist to add to
        theSong - song to be added
        Returns:
        true if the song was added to the station's playlist; false if the song was not added to the station's playlist
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the song being added does not exist in the system; if the station does not exist in the system
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the station or song is null

      • removeFromStation

        boolean removeFromStation​(Station theStation,
                          Song theSong)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.lang.NullPointerException
        Removes a song from the playlist for a radio station. This method will remove a song from a station's playlist and return true if the station allowed it. If the station did not allow the song to be removed (most likely because the playlist does not contain the song), then a song is not removed from the station's playlist and this method will return false. If the station does not exist in the system, then this method will throw an IllegalArguementException.
        Parameters:
        theStation - station containing the playlist to be removed from
        theSong - song to be removed
        Returns:
        true if the song was removed from the station's playlist; false if the song was not removed from the station's playlist
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the station does not exist in the system
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the station or song is null

      • rateSong

        void rateSong​(User theUser,
              Song theSong,
              int theRating)
       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
              java.lang.NullPointerException
        Sets a user's rating for a song, as a number of stars from 1 to 5. If the specified user did not rate the song yet, then this method will set the user's rating, as a number of stars, to the specified rating from 1 to 5. If the specified user already rated the song, then this method will change the rating to the new specified rating, as a number of stars, from 1 to 5. If the song or user does not exist in the system or the specified rating is less than 1 or greater than 5, then this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        theUser - user rating the song
        theSong - song being rated
        theRating - rating, as stars, from 1 to 5
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the song does not exist in the system; if the user does not exist in the system; if the rating is less than 1 or greater than 5
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either the user or the song is null

      • clearRating

        void clearRating​(User theUser,
                 Song theSong)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.lang.NullPointerException
        Clears a user's rating on a song. If this user has rated this song and the rating has not already been cleared, then the rating is cleared and the state will appear as if the rating was never made. If there is no such rating on record (either because this user has not rated this song, or because the rating has already been cleared), then this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        theUser - user whose rating should be cleared
        theSong - song from which the user's rating should be cleared
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user does not currently have a rating on record for the song
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if either the user or the song is null

      • predictRating

        int predictRating​(User theUser,
                  Song theSong)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  java.lang.NullPointerException
        Predicts the rating a user will assign to a song that they have not yet rated, as a number of stars from 1 to 5. This method looks at the ratings a user has given to previous songs that are similar to the unrated song, then predicts and returns a rating, as a number of stars, for the unrated song based on those ratings. If the user has already rated the song, this method will return the user's current rating. If the user has not rated any songs yet, then this method will return -1. If the user or the song does not exist in the system, then this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        theUser - user to predict a rating for
        theSong - song to predict rating for
        Returns:
        predicted rating if the user has not rated the song; current rating is the user has already rated the song; -1 if the user has not previously rated any songs
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user does not exist in the system; if the song does not exist in the system
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the user or the song is null

      • suggestSong

        Song suggestSong​(User theUser)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.lang.NullPointerException
        Suggests a song for a user that they are predicted to like. This method looks at all of the previous songs a user has rated and compares the highest rated songs to all of the songs in the system that the user has not rated, this method then returns the first unrated song in the system that is similar to the user's highest rated songs. If there are no unrated songs or there are no songs that can be suggested, then this method returns null. If the user does not exist in the system, then this method will throw an IllegalArgumentException.
        Parameters:
        theUser - user to suggest a song for
        Returns:
        a song the user is predicted to like; null if there are no unrated songs; null if no song can be suggested
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the user does not exist in the system
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the user is null
